quests.metal_age.subtitle: Your first technological advancements.
quests.metal_age.weld_bronze_ingots.subt: I told you to get used to it
quests.metal_age.weld_bronze_ingots.desc:
Obtain at the very least 14 Ingots of any Bronze Type, then weld them together in the Copper Anvil.

The Tier 2 Anvil can be made from Bismuth Bronze, Bronze or Black Bronze, but not a mixture of the three.
quests.metal_age.anvil_recycling.title: Anvil Recycling?
quests.metal_age.anvil_recycling.subtitl: Because 14 Ingots is a lot now
quests.metal_age.anvil_recycling.desc:
Once you craft the next tier of Anvil (such as going from Copper to Bronze, or Bronze to Wrought Iron). The previous teir basically becomes useless.

However, since it's made out of metal, you  &ocan and should&r melt the previous tier of Anvil back into it's liquid metal form!
Grab a Vessel and place it on the right hand side of the Charcoal Forge Interface, Then place the Anvil and slowly heat it in a Forge until it reaches the melting temperature. The Molten Anvil will be deposited inside the Vessel, then it's just a matter of pouring the molten contents back into ingots.
quests.metal_age.bronze_anvil.title: T2 Anvil: Bronze
quests.metal_age.bronze_anvil.subtitle: Basic mechanical power starts here
quests.metal_age.bronze_anvil.desc:
With the Bronze Anvil you'll be able to work Bronze Ingots into different items such as Sheets, tool heads, etc. Working on the anvil can be a little bit complicated but there's an entry in the field guide detailing the process of working on the Anvil.

Bronze marks the start of the next age, the Industrial age, where you'll harness both Mechanical and Steam power.
quests.metal_age.bronze_goodies.title: Bronze level Mechanical Power
quests.metal_age.bronze_goodies.subtitle: Your basic &mC&rGreate starts here
quests.metal_age.bronze_goodies.desc:
Bronze is a sturdy enough material that allows you the creation of very, very basic Mechanical Powers.

Utilizing mechanical powers such as Millstones and the Helve Hammer you'll be able to automate the very beginning of specific recipe trees, such as automatic ore crushing.
quests.metal_age.copper_diving.title: Copper Diving Equipment
quests.metal_age.copper_diving.subtitle: If mining wasn't dangerous enough
quests.metal_age.copper_diving.desc: Struggling with aquifers in your veins? You can craft a set of copper diving equipment, with an air supply that lasts for 20 minutes!
quests.metal_age.bloomery.title: Bloomery
quests.metal_age.bloomery.subtitle: Required if you seek the Iron Age.
quests.metal_age.bloomery.desc:
The Bloomery is a Multiblock from TerraFirmaCraft that allows you to create Wrought Iron. Melting regular Iron produces Cast Iron, which while it has it's uses, its nowhere near as strong or durable as Wrought Iron, which is made in the Bloomery utilizing Iron and Charcoal

You'll probably need a lot more Bronze than youre expecting to consume for creating the Bloomery, you should definetly begin taking mining seriously at this point.

The Field Guide contains an entry on how the Bloomery works.
quests.metal_age.mining.title: Mining in the Metallurgy Age
quests.metal_age.mining.subtitle: ROCK AND STONE!
quests.metal_age.mining.desc:
During the Metallurgy Age you will consume a &llot&r of metal to create the Anvils, and in general progressing in the mod pack, while you maybe &ocould've&r obtain enough metal utilizing only Panning and Native Ores, you will definetly need to mine most of it.

If you need to clear large amounts of blocks you can utilize a Mining Hammer! It can mine blocks in a 3x3x1 area, which makes the creation of mining shafts considerably easier.
quests.metal_age.weld_wrought_iron_ingot: It'll always be at least 14 ingots.

Obtain at the very least 14 Ingots of Wrought Iron, then weld them together in the Bronze Anvil, You might need to reach very high temperatures to be able to weld the Wrought Iron Ingots, look at the quest above for some guidance.
quests.metal_age.bellows.title: Bellows
quests.metal_age.bellows.subtitle: Higher temperatures can be reached, at a small price.
quests.metal_age.bellows.desc:
The Bellows is a block that basically feeds fires or fuel consuming blocks that are either in front or one block down from the front. This allows the heat produced by the fuel inside to reach higher levels than their usual burning temperature, at the cost of fuel duration.

The Bellows is basically mandatory for working with Wrought Iron unless you have Coke or Coal.
quests.metal_age.wrought_iron_anvil.desc:
With the Wrought Iron Anvil you'll be able to work Wrought Iron Ingots into different items such as Sheets, Tool heads, etc.

Unlocking access to Wrought Iron Anvil enables new quests in the Industrial Age, related to better stress sources and some basic Greate machinery.

The next anvil is going to be probably the hardest one, considered overall your Rite of Passage.
quests.metal_age.coke_oven.title: Coke Oven
quests.metal_age.coke_oven.subtitle: Stop makin those Charcoal Piles
quests.metal_age.coke_oven.desc.1:
The Coke Oven is a Multiblock structure that allows you to create Charcoal and more powerful fuels using the power of time. Utilizing Wood, every 45 seconds the Coke Oven will consume 1 Log and create 1 Charcoal, but more importantly, 250mb of Creosote, which is an important oil used in the Industrial Age.

If you craft the Coke Oven block and press the JEI Usages key on it (defaults to "U"), you'll find the Tab called "Multiblock Info", you can use this tab to learn how to build the Coke Oven in the world.

You can also just place the Controller block in the world, and interact with it while sneaking to create a Hologram of blocks missing.
quests.metal_age.coke_oven.desc.2:
Coke Ovens can be automated using a Coke Oven Hatch. The Hatch is placed on the sides of the Oven and work as both Inputs and Outputs for both Items and Liquids.

You can easly create a simple, one way Coke Oven by utilizing a Crate for the item Input, another Crate for the item Output, and using a Bronze Drum to collect the Creosote. Unlike Chests, Crates are able to store large objects such as Logs. You can use a Wrench to force the Item Pipe to be one directional as well.
quests.metal_age.wrought_iron_goodies.su: What's this "Andesite Alloy" you speak of?
quests.metal_age.wrought_iron_goodies.de:
With Wrought Iron you've unlocked access to the Metal Casing, Metal Casings are used for a bulk of recipes for Create, unlocking things such as Gearboxes.

Utilizing Creosote you can create Treated Wood Planks, which are used in the creation of Waterwheels and Windmills, which are good sources of mechanical power.
quests.metal_age.fire_clay_ingredients.d:
Fire Clay is a special clay made out of Kaolinite, Graphite and regular Clay, Fire Clay is specially resistant to high temperatures. It's main purpose is to create the Crucible, which works as an improved version of a Vessel for Metal Smelting and Alloying, alongside the Blast Furance, which is required for the creation of the next Anvil and Metal tier, Steel.

You'll likely need to travel far, far away from your base to obtain both Graphite and Kaolin Clay, good luck!
quests.metal_age.overworld_kaolin.title: Kaolin Source: Overworld
quests.metal_age.overworld_kaolin.desc:
Kaolin Clay can be found in high altitude biomes, more importantly, it only spawns in temperate climates of at least 18Â°C with a rainfall of at least 300mm. More details regarding how to spot Kaolin can be found in the Field Guide

You'll very likely need to travel very, VERY far towards the South East. Preparing yourself with an Iron Flask, large quantities of Food, some sort of Watercraft like a Canoe, Rowboat or Kayak, and extra portable storage for bringing home as much Kaolin as you can.

There are quests in TerraFirmaGreg Tips that go over portable storage and watercrafts.
quests.metal_age.beneath_kaolin.title: Kaolin Source: The Beneath
quests.metal_age.beneath_kaolin.subtitle: To the Depths
quests.metal_age.beneath_kaolin.desc:
Deep, DEEP underground, past the bedrock, you'll find The Beneath, a complex network of caves filled with dangers and relatively strange flora and fauna. One of the biomes of The Beneath is the Lush Hollow, a small oasis in the depths where both Kaolin Clay and the Kaolin Klaze can spawn. The Kaolin Klaze is a monster that when killed, drops Kaolin Clay. You should also look for Coal or Anthracite, as both are required for making steel.

Surviving in the Beneath is difficult, check the TerraFirmaGrig Tips section of this questbook and the Field Guide for tips.
quests.metal_age.beneath_kaolin.task: Traverse the Overworld Bedrock and reach The Beneath
quests.metal_age.overworld_graphite.desc:
Graphite spawns exclusively in tall, thin veins on the Gabbro Rock, Gabbro spawns below Basalt.

While you could travel the world in search for it, a good idea might be to travel to an Ocean, which it's floor tends to be made out of Gabbro. Looking down or swimming underwater can help you spot these Graphite Veins.
quests.metal_age.beneath_graphite.title: Graphite Source: The Beneath
quests.metal_age.beneath_graphite.desc:
Deep, DEEP underground, past the bedrock, you'll find The Beneath, a complex network of caves filled with dangers and relatively strange flora and fauna. Inside the Beneath you can also find Graphite Veins, but also the Graphite Glayze, a monster that when killed drops Graphite, You should also look for Coal or Anthracite, as both are required for making steel.

Surviving in the Beneath is difficult, check the TerraFirmaGrig Tips section of this questbook and the Field Guide for tips.
quests.metal_age.beneath_graphite.task: Traverse the Overworld Bedrock and reach The Beneath
quests.metal_age.kaolin_clay.title: Kaolin Clay
quests.metal_age.kaolin_clay.subtitle: Everyone has to go thru the Kaolin Trek
quests.metal_age.kaolin_clay.desc:
Once you find Kaolin Clay, you should bring as much as humanly possible, If you brought a Backpack you could bring a mixture of Kaolin Clay, Kaolin Clay Blocks and Kaolinite Powder, which is made by heating up the Clay.

Bring as much as you can, Once you craft the Crucible and the Blast Furnace you won't need too much Kaolin, but it's still a good idea to bring a lot of it to avoid another adventure.
quests.metal_age.graphite.title: Graphite
quests.metal_age.graphite.subtitle: Pencils do not exist
quests.metal_age.graphite.desc: Once you find Graphite you should bring as much as you can, Graphite Veins are also rich in Coal and Diamonds, which are useful materials to have at home. Coal in particularly is very useful as it can be turned into Coke, and Coke or Anthracine is required for making Steel. Careful mining of the Graphite should be done, since it's veins are mostly vertical you can easily end up dying from a Cave In.
quests.metal_age.fire_clay.title: Fire Clay
quests.metal_age.fire_clay.subtitle: At last
quests.metal_age.fire_clay.desc:
Heat up Kaolin Clay to get Kaolinite Powder, you can use a Firepit or your Forge with vessels to mass-heat the Kaolin Clay.

For the Graphite, simply pass it thru a Quern or a Millstone to get Graphite Powder

Finally, combine 4 Graphite Powder, 4 Kaolinite and a piece of Clay to create Fire Clay.
quests.metal_age.fire_clay_products.desc:
Just like regular Clay, Fire Clay can be Knapped to create unfired pieces of Clay, Notably Fire Clay can be used to create the Crucible and Fire Clay Bricks, which are required for the Blast Furnace.

You'll also unlock the Fire Ingot, which has a 90% chance to not be destroyed when you get the Ingot out of the Mold.

You'll also be able to create a Mold Table and Casting Channels, which lets you cast multiple molds at once.
quests.metal_age.crucible.title: Crucible
quests.metal_age.crucible.subtitle: Melt metals, like a pro.
quests.metal_age.crucible.desc: The Crucible is an advanced block that can be placed on top of a Forge, Crucibles being heated by a Forge heat up considerably faster, they have 9 inventory slots and can hold up to 4 buckets of Molten Metal. Crucibles can also be emptied out utilizing Casting Channels, They are required for the Blast Furnace to work.
quests.metal_age.fire_bricks.title: Fire Bricks
quests.metal_age.fire_bricks.subtitle: For the Blast Furnace
quests.metal_age.fire_bricks.desc:
Fire Bricks are used in the construction of the Blast Furnace, you need at the very least 4 Bricks to make the furnace.

The Bricks will require insulation to make sure the process of making steel is effective, you can either place 3 Wrought Iron Sheets around the Fire Bricks, or use Blast Furnace Insulation
quests.metal_age.fully_stacked_blast_fur:
The completed Blast Furnace can melt and create a lot of Steel. You should seek to complete it as you'll need a lot of steel for the future.

It is worth mentioning that in the future, you'll be able to produce both Brick Dust and Clay Dust, mixing these dusts together can be used as a cheap method of creating more Fire Bricks.
quests.metal_age.blast_furnace_fuel.subt: Hope you followed the tips in the previous quests...
quests.metal_age.blast_furance_fuel.desc:
Regular Charcoal is not hot enough to be able to create Steel, you will need either Coke or Anthracite.

Coke can be created inside a Coke Oven by utilizing Coal instead of Logs, it produces considerably more Creosote as well.

Anthracite is a type of fuel found in the Beneath.
quests.metal_age.blast_furnace.title: Blast Furnace
quests.metal_age.blast_furnace.subtitle: I'm Blastin
quests.metal_age.blast_furnace.desc:
The BlastFurnace is a Multiblock form TerraFirmaCraft that allows you to create Steel. Placing a combination of Iron, Flux and Charcoal inside the Blast Furnace produces Pig Iron, which can be worked into Steel.

To get the Blast Furnace to properly melt down the ingredients, you'll require a Bellows to feed the Blast Furnace with Air, for the Blast Furnace to even accept the Air you'll require a Tuyere.

The Field Guide contains an entry on how the Blast Furnace works.
quests.metal_age.weld_steel_ingots.title: Welding Steel
quests.metal_age.weld_steel_ingots.desc:
You should know the drill by this point, Create 14 Steel Ingots, then Weld them to get 7 Double Steel Ingots.

This will be the last quest where we'll ask you to do this, since every single other Anvil requires the same setup.
quests.metal_age.steel_anvil.title: T4 Anvil: Steel
quests.metal_age.steel_anvil.subtitle: Encased Fans, Crushing Wheels, Mechanical Pumps and More
quests.metal_age.steel_anvil.desc:
With the Steel Anvil you'll be able to work Steel Ingots into different items.

Unlocking access to the Steel Anvil enables new quests in the Industrial Age, related to new processing machinery, and the Mechanical Pump.

The next anvil will unlock the very beginnings of GregTech's Steam Machinery.
quests.metal_age.steel_goodies.title: Steel level Mechanical Power
quests.metal_age.steel_goodies.subtitle: Blow, Crush and Pipe
quests.metal_age.steel_goodies.desc:
Steel unlocks a lot more of Greate's mechanical blocks, such as the Mechanical Fan, which is used for washing items in water, the Crushing Wheel, which is even faster and more efficient than the Millstone, and the Mechanical Pump

The Mechanical Pump is especially useful, as with some smarts, you can easily automate the Blast Furnace.
quests.metal_age.weak_steel.title: Weak Steel Ingredients
quests.metal_age.weak_steel.subtitle: Hope you like Alloying
quests.metal_age.weak_steel.desc:
Weak Steel is one part of the necesary metals to create Black Steel, it's made by utilizing 2 parts Steel, 1 part Nickel and 1 part Black Bronze.

You can check the liquid weak steel's recipe for  more precise alloying percentage rates.
quests.metal_age.highcarb_black_steel.su: Conservation of Matter does not apply
quests.metal_age.highcarb_black_steel.de: The last two anvils are made out of complex Alloys that will require a lot of metal to be created. Black Steel first starts as High Carbon Black Steel, which is made by welding Weak Steel and Pig Iron. It the needs to be worked on the Anvil to turn it into Black Steel
quests.metal_age.black_steel_anvil.title: T5 Anvil: Black Steel
quests.metal_age.black_steel_anvil.desc:
With the Black Steel Anvil you'll be able to work Black Steel Ingots into different items.

Unlocking access to the Black Steel Anvil enables new quests in the Industrial Age, related to Steam Power. From both the Steam Engine and the High Pressure Steam Boilers.

Only one more tier to go.
quests.metal_age.black_steel_goodies.sub: The Industrial Revolution and it's consequences
quests.metal_age.black_steel_goodies.des: Black Steel unlocks the Steam components of both Greate and GregTech, mainly the Steam Engine and the High Pressure Broilers. With the Broilers you'll be able to produce Steam, and with it, power Steam Machinery such as Forge Hammers, Macerators, Extractors, Alloyers and More.
quests.metal_age.red_blu.title: Red and Blue Steel
quests.metal_age.red_blu.subtitle: Totally not a reference to another game
quests.metal_age.red_blu.desc:
The final tier of Anvil, T6, is made by utilizing Red or Blue steel, both are complex alloys of Steel and multiple different metals.

Red and Blue steel are known for their exceptional durability, heat resistance, and overall power. The following anvil creation can be made by either using Blue or Red Steel.
quests.metal_age.weak_red_steel.title: Weak Red Steel Ingredients
quests.metal_age.weak_red_steel.subtitle: This is getting a little ridiculous
quests.metal_age.weak_red_steel.desc:
Weak Red Steel is one part of the necesary metals to create Red Steel, it's made by utilizing 4 parts Black Steel, 2 parts Steel, 1 part Brass and 1 part Rose Gold.

You can check the liquid weak red steel's recipe for more precise alloying percentage rates.
quests.metal_age.weak_blu_steel.title: Weak Blue Steel Ingredients
quests.metal_age.weak_blu_steel.subtitle: This is getting out of hand.
quests.metal_age.weak_blu_steel.desc:
Weak Blue Steel is one part of necesary metals to create Blue Steel, it's made by utilizing 4 parts Black Steel, 2 parts Steel, 1 part Bismuth Bronze and 1 part Sterling Silver.
 You can check the liquid weak blue steel's recipe for more precise alloying percentage rates.
quests.metal_age.highcarb_red_steel.subt: If you think about it the fact that one half of the ingot disappears would mean there's a lot of energy being released, probably higher than the Tsar Bomba... oh well it's just a modpack.
quests.metal_age.highcarb_red_steel.desc: Red Steel first starts as High Carbon Red Steel, which is made by welding Weak Red Steel and Black Steel. It needs to be worked on the Anvil to turn it into Red Steel
quests.metal_age.highcarb_blu_steel.subt: Lavoisier is rolling in his grave
quests.metal_age.highcarb_blu_steel.desc: Blue Steel first starts as High Carbon Blue Steel, whcih is made by welding Weak Blue Steel and Black Steel. It needs to be worked on the Anvil to turn it into Blue Steel
quests.metal_age.redblu_anvil.title: T6 Anvil: Red or Blue Steel
quests.metal_age.redblu_anvil.subtitle: It's over
quests.metal_age.redblu_anvil.desc:
The final tier of Anvil, with the Tier 6 Anvil you'll be able to work both Red and Blue Steel Ingots into different items.

This marks the End of the regular TerraFirmaCraft progression, now it's time to finish the Industrial Age and create your very first Low Voltage circuitry.
quests.metal_age.red_steel_flask.title: Red Steel Flask
quests.metal_age.red_steel_flask.subtitl: This got nothing on the Iron Flask
quests.metal_age.red_steel_flask.desc: The Red Steel Flask is the best Flask in the game, it may hold the same amount of liquid as an Iron Flask, but the Red Steel Flask never breaks.
quests.metal_age.redblu_buckets.title: Bucket Components
quests.metal_age.redblu_buckets.subtitle: Not quite the bucket
quests.metal_age.redblu_buckets.desc: The ending of the regular progression of the Metallurgy Age is creating a Bucket. The Bucket can be used to hold lava and other hot liquids without having it melt in your hands.
quests.metal_age.this_is_a_bucket.title: This, is a Bucket.
quests.metal_age.this_is_a_bucket.desc:
Congratulations on crafting the Bucket. The Metallurgy Age is officially over.

Go and start working on those Low Voltage components.
